a.g: [All] praise is [due] to Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allah is over all things competent.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 3
Indeed, the text indicates the permissibility of listening to the beautiful voice [al-sawt al-hasan] as a favor [minna] from God, the Exalted, upon His servants, when He said, "He increases in creation what He wills," and it is said this refers to the beautiful voice [al-sawt al-hasan].
j2 k08
Indeed, the text indicates the permissibility of listening to the beautiful voice [al-sawt al-hasan] as a favor [minna] from God, the Exalted, upon His servants, when He said, "He increases in creation what He wills," and it is said this refers to the beautiful voice [al-sawt al-hasan].

a.g: Whatever Allah grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
O mankind, remember the favor of Allah upon you. Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
And if they deny you, [O Muhammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allah are returned [all] matters.
O mankind, indeed the promise of Allah is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allah by the Deceiver.
Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j3 k01
Indeed, the satan [shaytan] sat for the son of Adam upon the paths, so he sat for him upon the path of Islam [Islam] and said, "Will you submit [Islam] and abandon your religion and the religion of your fathers?" So he disobeyed him and submitted [aslama]. Then he sat for him upon the path of emigration [hijra] and said, "Will you emigrate? Will you leave your land and your sky?" So he disobeyed him and emigrated [hajara]. Then he sat for him upon the path of struggle [jihad] and said, "Will you struggle [jihad]? It is the destruction of the self [nafs] and wealth. So you will fight and be killed, then your women will be married and your wealth divided." So he disobeyed him and struggled [jahada]. And the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "So whoever does that and dies, it is a right upon God to admit him to Paradise." So the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, mentioned the meaning of the whispering [waswasa]—and it is these thoughts [khawatir] which occur to the struggler [mujahid] that he will be killed and his women married, and other than that which turns him away from the struggle [jihad]. And these thoughts [khawatir] are known. So therefore, the whisperer [waswas] is known by observation. And every thought [khatir] has a cause [sabab] and requires a name by which it is known. So the name of its cause [sabab] is the satan [shaytan]. And it is inconceivable that any human [adami] be free from him. They only differ by disobeying him or following him. And for that reason, peace be upon him, said, "There is no one except that he has a satan [shaytan]." So it has become clear by this type of insight [istibsar] the meaning of whispering [waswasa] and inspiration [ilham], the angel [malak] and the satan [shaytan], success [tawfiq] and abandonment [khidhlan]. So after this, let the one who looks look into the essence [dhat] of the satan [shaytan]: is he a subtle body [jism latif] or is he not a body [jism]? And if he is a body [jism], then how does he enter the body [badan] of the human [insan] when he is a body [jism]? This now is not needed in the science of transaction ['ilm al-mu'amala]. Rather, the example of the one who researches this is like the example of one into whose clothes a snake has entered, and he needs to remove it and repel its harm, yet he busies himself with researching its color, its shape, its length, and its width. And that is the very essence of ignorance [jahl]. So clashing with the thoughts [khawatir] that incite to evil [sharr] is already known, and that indicates that it is from a cause [sabab] without doubt, and it is known that the caller to the evil [sharr] that is feared in the future is an enemy ['aduww]. So the enemy ['aduww] is known without doubt. Therefore, one should busy himself with struggling against him [mujahadatuhu]. And God, glorified and exalted, has made known his enmity ['adawa] in many places in His Book, so that one may believe in it and be cautious of him. So the Exalted said, ***"Indeed, the satan [shaytan] is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze."*** And the Exalted said, ***"Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship the satan [shaytan]? Indeed, he is to you a clear enemy."*** Therefore, it is incumbent upon the servant ['abd] to busy himself with repelling the enemy ['aduww] from himself, not with asking about his origin, his lineage, or his dwelling. Yes, he should ask about his weapon [silah] so he can repel him from himself. And the weapon [silah] of the satan [shaytan] is caprice [hawa] and desires [shahawat]. And that is sufficient for the knowers ['alimin].

a.g: Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.

Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allah sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allah is Knowing of what they do.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 1
Indeed, is he whose evil deed [sū’ ‘amalihi] has been made pleasing to him, so he sees it as good? (Qur'an 35:8). Thus, every innovation [mā aḥdatha] that has occurred after the Companions, may God be pleased with them, which exceeds the measure of necessity [ḍarūra] and need [ḥāja], is from play [la‘ib] and diversion [lahw].

a.g: And it is Allah who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.

Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to Allah belongs all honor. To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it. But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

j2 k06
Then from this seed is generated the tree of love [mahabbah] and knowledge [ma'rifah], and it is the goodly word [al-kalimah al-tayyibah] for which Allah has set forth a parable when He said: "Allah sets forth a parable of a goodly word like a goodly tree, its root firm and its branches in the sky." And to it is the allusion in His saying, the Most High: "To Him ascends the goodly word [al-kalim al-tayyib]," meaning knowledge [ma'rifah], "and the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] raises it." So the righteous deed [al-'amal al-salih] is like beauty for this knowledge [ma'rifah] and like a servant. And indeed, all righteous action [al-'amal al-salih] is in purifying the heart [qalb] first from the world [al-dunya], then in preserving its purity. So the deed is not desired except for this knowledge [ma'rifah].

a.g: And Allah created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for Allah is easy.

And not alike are the two bodies of water. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.

He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.

If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association. And none can inform you like [one] Acquainted [with all matters].
O mankind, you are those in need of Allah, while Allah is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.
And that is for Allah not difficult.

And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allah is the [final] destination.
Not equal are the blind and the seeing,
Nor are the darknesses and the light,
Nor are the shade and the heat,
And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allah causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.
You, [O Muhammad], are not but a warner.
Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.
Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.

And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allah, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allah is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol1 book 1
Indeed, knowledge of the causes of what is detested is the motivating, provoking cause for the burning [iḥrāq] of the heart [qalb] and its pain, and that burning is fear [khawf]. Likewise, fear of God, Exalted is He, arises at times from knowledge [maʿrifa] of God, Exalted is He, and knowledge of His attributes—that if He destroyed all the worlds He would not care, and no preventer could prevent Him. At times it arises from the abundance of the servant's offenses through committing sins. At times it arises from both together. And according to his knowledge of the faults of his own soul [nafs], and his knowledge of the majesty [jalāl] of God, Exalted is He, and His self-sufficiency—that He is not questioned about what He does, while they will be questioned—so his fear becomes strong. Therefore, the most fearful of people towards his Lord are those most knowledgeable of themselves and their Lord. For this reason, He, peace be upon him, said: "I am the most fearful of you towards God." And likewise, God, Exalted is He, said: "Only those among His servants who have knowledge [ʿulamāʾ] fear God." Then, when knowledge is perfected, it bequeaths the majesty of fear and the burning of the heart. Then the effect of the burning overflows from the heart onto the body, onto the limbs, and onto the attributes. As for in the body, it is through emaciation, pallor, fainting, cries, and weeping. The gallbladder may even rupture from it, leading to death, or it may ascend to the brain and corrupt the intellect, or it may become strong and beget despair and hopelessness. As for in the limbs, it is by restraining them from sins and binding them to acts of obedience, making up for what was neglected and preparing for what is to come. For this reason it is said: "The one who is fearful is not he who weeps and wipes his eyes, but rather he who abandons what he fears he will be punished for." And Abū al-Qāsim al-Ḥakīm said: "Whoever fears something flees from it, but whoever fears God flees to Him." And it was said to Dhū al-Nūn: "When is a servant fearful?" He said: "When he places his soul in the position of a sick person who abstains, fearing a prolonged illness." As for in the attributes, it is by suppressing the appetites and clouding the pleasures, so that sins which were beloved to him become detested, just as honey becomes detested to one who desires it when he knows it contains poison. Thus, the appetites are burned by fear, the limbs are disciplined, and there occurs in the heart withering, humility, abasement, and submissiveness. Arrogance, rancor, and envy depart from it. Rather, he becomes wholly consumed by his preoccupation with his fear and by looking at the peril of his outcome. He has no leisure for anything else, and he has no occupation except vigilance [murāqaba], self-reckoning [muḥāsaba], striving [mujāhada], and being miserly with his breaths and glances, holding his soul to account for its passing thoughts, its steps, and its words. His state becomes like the state of one who has fallen into the claws of a ferocious beast, not knowing if it will become heedless of him so he escapes, or if it will pounce upon him so he perishes. Thus, his outward and inward become preoccupied with what he fears, with no room in him for anything else. This is the state of one whom fear has overcome and taken possession of. And such was the state of a group of the Companions and the Successors. The strength of vigilance, self-reckoning, and striving is according to the strength of the fear, which is the pain and burning of the heart. And the strength of the fear is according to the strength of the knowledge of the majesty of God and His attributes and His acts, and of the faults of the soul, and of the perils and terrors that lie before it. The lowest degree of fear from which its effect appears in actions is that which prevents from the forbidden matters. The restraint resulting from the forbidden matters is called scrupulousness [warʿ]. If its strength increases, it restrains from that to which the possibility of prohibition extends, so he also restrains from that which he is not certain is forbidden. That is called God-consciousness [taqwā], for God-consciousness is to leave what causes you doubt for what does not cause you doubt.

He said: "When he places his soul in the position of a sick person who abstains, fearing a prolonged illness." As for in the attributes, it is by suppressing the appetites and clouding the pleasures, so that sins which were beloved to him become detested, just as honey becomes detested to one who desires it when he knows it contains poison. Thus, the appetites are burned by fear, the limbs are disciplined, and there occurs in the heart withering, humility, abasement, and submissiveness. Arrogance, rancor, and envy depart from it. Rather, he becomes wholly consumed by his preoccupation with his fear and by looking at the peril of his outcome. He has no leisure for anything else, and he has no occupation except vigilance [murāqaba], self-reckoning [muḥāsaba], striving [mujāhada], and being miserly with his breaths and glances, holding his soul to account for its passing thoughts, its steps, and its words. His state becomes like the state of one who has fallen into the claws of a ferocious beast, not knowing if it will become heedless of him so he escapes, or if it will pounce upon him so he perishes. Thus, his outward and inward become preoccupied with what he fears, with no room in him for anything else. This is the state of one whom fear has overcome and taken possession of. And such was the state of a group of the Companions and the Successors. The strength of vigilance, self-reckoning, and striving is according to the strength of the fear, which is the pain and burning of the heart. And the strength of the fear is according to the strength of the knowledge of the majesty of God and His attributes and His acts, and of the faults of the soul, and of the perils and terrors that lie before it. The lowest degree of fear from which its effect appears in actions is that which prevents from the forbidden matters. The restraint resulting from the forbidden matters is called scrupulousness [warʿ]. If its strength increases, it restrains from that to which the possibility of prohibition extends, so he also restrains from that which he is not certain is forbidden. That is called God-consciousness [taqwā], for God-consciousness is to leave what causes you doubt for what does not cause you doubt.

a.g: Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allah and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a profit that will never perish -
That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.
And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muhammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed, Allah, of His servants, is Acquainted and Seeing.

Then we caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants; and among them is he who wrongs himself, and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allah. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.
[For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
And they will say, "Praise to Allah, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -
He who has settled us in the home of duration out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."
And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do we recompense every ungrateful one.

And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol4 book10
Indeed, Muhammad ibn Ka'b said: For the people of the Fire [ahl al-nar] there are five supplications to which Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, responds in four; and when the fifth comes, they will never speak after it... So they will say, "Our Lord, remove us; we will do righteous deeds [salih], other than what we used to do." And Allah, the Exalted, will answer them, "Did We not give you long enough life that whoever would remember [tadhakkara] could remember therein? And the warner [nathir] came to you. So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers [zalimin] any helper." Then they will say, "Our Lord, our wretchedness overcame us, and we were a people astray [dallin]. Our Lord, remove us from it; and if we return [to evil], then indeed we are wrongdoers [zalimin]." And Allah, the Exalted, will answer them, "Remain despised therein and do not speak to Me." So they will not speak after it ever, and that is the ultimate severity of the punishment ['adhab].

a.g: Indeed, Allah is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.

It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.

Say, "Have you considered your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allah? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."
Indeed, Allah holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing and Forgiving.

And they swore by Allah their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion.

[Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way of Allah any change, and you will never find in the way of Allah any alteration.
a.ihya:
Ihya 'Ulum al-Din Commentary

Vol3 book5a
Behold how God exacts retribution from the envier [al-hasid] when he desires the removal of blessing [ni'ma] from the one envied [al-mahsud], yet does not remove it from him, then removes it from the envier himself. For safety from sin [al-ithm] is a blessing, and safety from grief [al-ghamm] and sorrow [al-kamad] is a blessing, and both have been removed from him, confirming the truth of His Exalted Word: "And the evil plot does not enclose except its own people."

a.g: Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But Allah is not to be caused failure by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.

And if Allah were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon the earth any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allah has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.
